title: How to Make Spiced Star Christmas Cookies

steps.headline: Cream together the butter and the vegetable shortening and gradually add the sugar.
steps.description: Beat in the molasses or golden syrup, then gradually add the cream.

steps.headline: Beat the mixture until it's light and fluffy.
Sift together the flour, cinnamon, and ginger.
steps.description: Add it to the mix. Store it in a covered up bowl in the refrigerator overnight.

steps.headline: Roll the dough thin with a floured pastry cloth on a smooth surface with a rolling pin.
steps.description: When the dough is smooth but still a little thick, cut out star shapes using the cookie cutter.

steps.headline: Place the cookies on greased baking sheets.
Bake in the oven at 350, for 10-12 minutes.
steps.description: Using a palette knife, carefully remove cookies from the baking sheets and place them on the cooling racks.

steps.headline: Carefully outline the cookies carefully with either red or green icing when they are cool.
steps.description: Add a silver ball onto each star point while the icing is still wet.

text: Cream together the butter and the vegetable shortening and gradually add the sugar. Beat in the molasses or golden syrup, then gradually add the cream. Beat the mixture until it's light and fluffy.  Sift together the flour, cinnamon, and ginger. Add it to the mix. Store it in a covered up bowl in the refrigerator overnight. Roll the dough thin with a floured pastry cloth on a smooth surface with a rolling pin. When the dough is smooth but still a little thick, cut out star shapes using the cookie cutter. Place the cookies on greased baking sheets.  Bake in the oven at 350, for 10-12 minutes. Using a palette knife, carefully remove cookies from the baking sheets and place them on the cooling racks. Carefully outline the cookies carefully with either red or green icing when they are cool. Add a silver ball onto each star point while the icing is still wet.
